body.p: The IASB decided that, if not presented separately in the balance sheet, right-of-use assets should be included within the same line item as similar owned assets. The IASB concluded that, if right-of-use assets are not presented as a line item, presenting similar leased and owned assets together would provide more useful information to users of financial statements than other approaches. This is because a lessee often uses owned assets and leased assets for the same purpose and derives similar economic benefits from the use of owned assets and leased assets.
